methodology.notes: Wiki Source. Sastre has an account on this site, and logging in makes some small improvements to what you can see. This website's layout is easily navigable, so it's good to check for a general overview. However, it's not 100% reliable, especially for historical information (including establishment date), so any information to be cited in a report should ideally be verified at https://www.unternehmensregister.de (see below). Moreover, companyhouse.de tries to charge extra for certain information, such as shareholder details, which can be obtained for free from unternehmensregister.de. Never buy any filings from companyhouse.de, because the same documents can all be obtained for free from unternehmensregister.de.

methodology.label: Find all companies where person is officer/director (recursive)
methodology.source: Find all companies where person is officer/director (recursive)
methodology.notes: Recursively finds all directorships for a person. Input: officer_name (59), person_name (7/31). Returns: All companies (42/13) + full officer details. For network mapping and directorship graphs.

methodology.label: Trace ownership pyramids via beneficial owner (cascade)
methodology.source: Trace ownership pyramids via beneficial owner (cascade)
methodology.notes: Cascading search: Given beneficial owner name, find all owned companies, then recursively find companies owned by those companies. Reveals ownership pyramids and shell company networks.

methodology.label: Find corporate networks via shared address (property clustering)
methodology.source: Find corporate networks via shared address (property clustering)
methodology.notes: Shell company cluster detection: Given address, find all companies registered there, then cross-reference officers and beneficial owners. Reveals mail-drop services and nominee director networks.

methodology.label: Map corporate structure: parent to subsidiaries + officers (recursive)
methodology.source: Map corporate structure: parent to subsidiaries + officers (recursive)
methodology.notes: Full corporate structure mapping: Given parent company, recursively find all subsidiaries (via shareholdings), then get officers for each entity. Reveals complete corporate family tree.

methodology.label: Map investment portfolio: shareholder to all holdings (recursive)
methodology.source: Map investment portfolio: shareholder to all holdings (recursive)
methodology.notes: Investment network mapping: Given shareholder (person or company), find all companies where they hold shares. If shareholder is a company, recursively trace its portfolio. Reveals investment strategies and connected entities.

methodology.label: Officer network: find shared directorships and connections
methodology.source: Officer network: find shared directorships and connections
methodology.notes: Network analysis: Given officer name, find all their appointments, then find all other officers at those companies, then find their appointments. Reveals director networks and interlocking directorates.

methodology.label: Full corporate-person network: company to all connected individuals
methodology.source: Full corporate-person network: company to all connected individuals
methodology.notes: Comprehensive person mapping: Given company, extract all officers, beneficial owners, and shareholders, then cross-reference their other appointments. Maps entire human network around a company.

methodology.label: Gvin
methodology.notes: Wiki Source. Gvin (Commercial business registry of Bisnode)] (''paid'', ''reg'') - Search by names of directors/shareholders. Offers all the financial data from annual reports (incl. for years before 2008/2009, which are usually the earliest years you get annual reports for at Ajpes). Info on tax payments, ongoing lawsuits and credit ratings (the latter is a payable service of Ajpes). If a company changed its name, Ajpes would return no results, while Gvin would detect it and put you through to the "new" company. Offers all available documents in one place (except those you can find only at the court register - memorandum/articles of association, insolvency reports, statute). You can click on the address of a company and see what other companies are registered there. Registration and payment required.
